channel.title: I need help with chords/basics
channel.description: So I've been using Auxy for about 9 months now, but I've never been able to make good chord progressions. However, since I'm a big fan of progressive house, I really want to be able to make good chord progressions. Therefore I started looking online for the basic music theory. I've found several guides for beginners, but when reading those guides I still haven't got a clue what they're talking about. Therefore I came to the conclusion that my knowledge and understanding of the theory behind music is ZERO. Do you guys perhaps have any tips or websites to help me get started? I would really appreciate it :)

item.title: I need help with chords/basics
item.dc:creator: CammeoCam
item.description:
It really depends on what kind of music you are trying to make, my “go to” chords will be: first note the bass line, skip a white note and put another one, skip another and put one there too (going up). Keep adding to it and change the chord structure for different sounds!

Read full topic

item.title: I need help with chords/basics

item.description:
Yeah this was just a draft. Thanks!

item.title: I need help with chords/basics
item.dc:creator: LunarAura
item.description:
Put one note on the first line, put another on the third line, and another on the fifth. Heres an example project with Examples in it https://app.auxy.co/projects/XX4V8Yv06cSffU1N8THZwg==

item.title: I need help with chords/basics
item.dc:creator: Stigmo
item.description:
So I’ve been using Auxy for about 9 months now, but I’ve never been able to make good chord progressions. However, since I’m a big fan of progressive house, I really want to be able to make good chord progressions. Therefore I started looking online for the basic music theory. I’ve found several guides for beginners, but when reading those guides I still haven’t got a clue what they’re talking about. Therefore I came to the conclusion that my knowledge and understanding of the theory behind music is ZERO. Do you guys perhaps have any tips or websites to help me get started? I would really appreciate it
